item.title: 破坏性勒索软件攻击困扰 "大型游戏 "目标
item.description: 研究人员说，网络犯罪集团正在大肆狩猎。【原文：Cybercrime groups are big-game hunting, researchers say.】

item.title: 英国保守党以减税计划召唤撒切尔以求生存
item.description: 在英国保守党急于避免被政治遗忘的情况下，参加该党年会的代表们发现自己需要向 35 年前离任的首相寻求指导。保守党妇女协会的海报上写道："向铁娘子请教"。【原文：With Britain’s venerable Conservatives desperate to avoid political oblivion, delegates at the party’s annual conference found themselves prompted to seek guidance from a prime minister who left office 35 years ago. “Ask the Iron Lady,” urged a poster from the Conservative Women’s Association.】

item.title: 德国因天然气库存低于正常水平而面临 400 亿欧元损失的风险
item.description: 根据能源公司 Uniper SE 委托进行的一项研究，如果今年冬天异常寒冷，天然气库存过低，德国经济可能遭受高达 400 亿欧元（464 亿美元）的损失。【原文：Germany’s economy could suffer losses of as much as €40 billion ($46.4 billion) if this winter is exceptionally cold and natural gas stockpiles are too low, according to a study commissioned by energy company Uniper SE.】

item.title: 卡塔尔能源公司德克萨斯州液化天然气厂即将启动冷却设备
item.description: 卡塔尔能源公司（QatarEnergy）和埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.）共同拥有的德克萨斯州 Golden Pass 液化天然气项目在推迟数月后即将启动，目前正准备冷却关键设备。【原文：The Golden Pass liquefied natural gas project in Texas, co-owned by QatarEnergy and Exxon Mobil Corp., is preparing to cool key equipment as it nears startup after months of delay.】

item.title: 英国央行不应被拖入更广泛的经济目标，皮尔说
item.description: 英国央行首席经济学家休-皮尔（Huw Pill）在呼吁 "保守的中央银行 "时说，尽管英国面临诸多问题，但货币政策制定者不应试图解决英国的所有经济问题，而应坚持应对通胀这一核心任务。【原文：Monetary policymakers should not try to fix all Britain’s economic problems despite the issues the country faces but stick to the core job of tackling inflation, Bank of England Chief Economist Huw Pill said in a call for “conservative central banking.”】

item.title: 俄罗斯提高九月份原油产量，但仍落后于欧佩克+的目标
item.description: 在欧佩克+对其补偿计划进行最新调整后，俄罗斯 9 月份的原油产量有所增加，但却落后于欧佩克+的目标。【原文：Russia increased crude oil production in September while falling behind its OPEC+ target following the latest adjustments to the alliance’s compensation plans.】

item.title: Blackstone 接近完成 2022 年以来最大一笔欧洲写字楼融资
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone Inc）即将获得法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）安排的 5.3 亿欧元（6.15 亿美元）贷款，为巴黎的一项收购提供资金，这再次表明银行贷款人愿意为大型写字楼交易提供资金。【原文：Blackstone Inc is close to securing a €530 million ($615 million) loan arranged by Societe Generale SA to finance a Paris acquisition, another sign that bank lenders are willing to finance major office deals.】

item.title: 东京海上权衡超过 100 亿美元的国际并购交易
item.description: 日本最大的财产和意外保险公司东京海上控股公司（Tokio Marine Holdings Inc.【原文：Tokio Marine Holdings Inc., Japan’s top property and casualty insurer, could spend more than $10 billion on acquisitions to boost its international business, according to Brad Irick, who co-heads the unit.】

item.title: 贝莱德的哈斯凯尔预计小额贷款公司业绩将加速增长
item.description: 市政债券市场刚刚创下了自 2023 年 12 月以来回报率最高的一个月；该领域的一位投资巨头称，这一势头将持续到 2025 年底。【原文：The municipal-bond market just clocked its best month of returns since December 2023 — and one investing giant in the space says that momentum will continue through the end of 2025.】

item.title: Cantor 就第一品牌风险问题寻求与瑞银对冲基金部门达成新协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Cantor Fitzgerald LP 正在寻求改变从瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）收购 O'Connor 对冲基金部门的条款，因为该业务面临着 First Brands Group 破产带来的巨大损失。【原文：Cantor Fitzgerald LP is seeking to change the terms of its purchase of the O’Connor hedge-fund unit from UBS Group AG as the business faces big losses from the bankruptcy of First Brands Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 高盛计划将 SRT 与 50 亿美元企业贷款挂钩
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is selling a significant risk transfer tied to a portfolio of about $5 billion of corporate loans, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Planet Labs 将发射卫星，有望在一小时内提供图像
item.description: Planet Labs PBC 将发射一个地球观测卫星星座，有望在一小时内提供分辨率更高的人工智能分析图像。【原文：Planet Labs PBC will launch a constellation of Earth observation satellites promising to deliver higher-resolution, AI-analyzed images within an hour.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州养老金将在私人市场投注上花费高达 150 亿美元
item.description: 得克萨斯州市政退休系统计划在未来五年内投入多达 150 亿美元，用于一项允许其与外部基金经理一起直接投资于私人市场交易的计划。【原文：Texas Municipal Retirement System plans to commit as much as $15 billion over the next five years to a program that will allow it to invest directly in private markets transactions alongside its external fund managers.】

item.title: 谁来捍卫大人工智能？
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 北达科他州将成为第二个通过 "Roughrider "代币发行稳定币的州
item.description: 北达科他州计划继怀俄明州之后，成为第二个发行稳定币的州，在这种情况下，最初是为了促进银行间交易，同时在美国金融系统中更广泛地试用数字代币。【原文：North Dakota plans to follow Wyoming to become only the second state to issue a stablecoin, in this case to initially facilitate bank-to-bank transactions while the digital tokens are being more widely experimented with in the US the financial system.】

item.title: 国库券飙升引发美国将削减售券量的猜测
item.description: 美国财政部出人意料地增加了短期债券的发行量，这可能表明美国政府正准备在 11 月份宣布再融资计划时削减一些长期票面债券的发行规模。【原文：The US Treasury’s surprising increases in its offering of short-dated debt could indicate the government is preparing to cut the sizes on some of its longer-term coupon offerings when it announces its refinancing plans in November.】

item.title: 约翰霍普金斯大学和洛约拉大学将增加对巴尔的摩财政的年度捐款
item.description: 巴尔的摩市市长布兰登-斯科特（Brandon Scott）表示，与该市最大的非营利组织达成的一项新协议要求这些组织逐步增加对该市国库的捐款。【原文：Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott says a new agreement with the city’s largest nonprofits requires them to gradually increase their contributions to the city’s coffers.】

item.title: 将前往 Citadel 的 Marshall Wace 交易员寻求从加密货币大奖中分得一杯羹
item.description: 前 Marshall Wace 交易员斯科特-阿诺德（Scott Arnold）要求从对冲基金早期投资 Circle Internet Group Inc.【原文：Former Marshall Wace trader Scott Arnold is seeking a cut from the hedge fund’s gains tied to an early investment in Circle Internet Group Inc., claiming he initiated the trade that’s now on track to becoming one of the firm’s most profitable wagers.】

item.title: 投资者为何对黄金爱不释手？
item.description: 几个世纪以来，黄金一直是政治和经济不稳定时期的避风港资产。黄金作为一种可靠的高价值商品，可以方便地运输并在任何地方出售，当其他一切都处于动荡之中时，黄金给人一种安全感。【原文：For centuries, gold has been the go-to haven asset in times of political and economic uncertainty. Its status as a reliably high-value commodity that can be transported easily and sold anywhere offers a sense of safety when everything else is in turmoil.】

item.title: 花旗银行在截止日期前将尼日利亚分部的资本结构调整至 1.36 亿美元
item.description: 花旗银行向其尼日利亚分部注入了新的资本，在 3 月份的最后期限之前达到了西非国家央行规定的新的最低资本门槛。【原文：Citi has injected fresh capital into its Nigerian unit, meeting a new minimum capital threshold set by the West African nation’s central bank ahead of a March deadline.】

item.title: 危机加深，法国银行主权风险可控
item.description: 分析师和投资者表示，法国银行应该能够应对该国日益扩大的政治危机所带来的任何风险，但这并不意味着一路不会崎岖不平。【原文：French banks should be able to navigate any risks from the widening political crisis in the country, but that doesn’t mean the ride won’t be bumpy, analysts and investors said.】

item.title: 美国大豆收割开始，农民 "为生存而战
item.description: 美国中心地带的秋季开始得像夏天一样，这意味着农田正在迅速干涸，迫使农民在植物倒地前收集农作物。【原文：A summer-like start to autumn across the US heartland means that crop fields are rapidly drying out, forcing farmers to gather crops before plants crumble to the ground.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织总裁称世界经济仍面临增长风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁表示，全球经济在最初的贸易中断浪潮中表现出了韧性，但她警告说不要自满，因为如果没有审慎的政策，金融市场和经济增长可能会迅速恶化。【原文：The head of the International Monetary Fund said the global economy showed resilience to an initial wave of trade disruptions, but she warned against complacency because financial markets and growth can sour quickly without prudent policies.】

item.title: 鲸石公司摆脱 20% 的首季亏损，股价反弹
item.description: 鲸岩资本管理公司（Whale Rock Capital Management）的旗舰基金在今年前九个月上涨了 14%，从第一季度的大幅亏损中恢复过来，并击败了许多选股对手。【原文：Whale Rock Capital Management’s flagship fund gained 14% in the first nine months of the year, recovering from a steep first-quarter loss and beating many of its stock-picking rivals.】

item.title: 据说 Alliance Laundry 将指导 IPO 定价为每股 22 美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Alliance Laundry Holdings Inc. 正告知潜在投资者，该公司预计将扩大首次公开发行股票的规模，并将股票定价为每股 22 美元，即市场定价范围的上限。【原文：Alliance Laundry Holdings Inc. is telling prospective investors it expects to upsize its initial public offering and price the shares at $22 each, the top of a marketed range, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 交易员期待美联储会议纪要，美股震荡走高
item.description: 周三开盘后，美国股市逐步走高，结束了自五月以来最长的连涨势头，交易员们期待美联储九月份的会议纪要能为今年可能还会有多少次降息提供线索。【原文：US stocks crept higher following the opening bell Wednesday after snapping their longest winning streak since May as traders look ahead to minutes from the Federal Reserve’s September meeting for clues on how many more interest-rate cuts may be coming this year.】

item.title: 巴尔认为放松对大银行的监管是对社区银行的威胁
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）认为，特朗普时代放松规则、放松对华尔街贷款机构监管的举措是一个错误，并表示最近的资本提案威胁到了对小型银行的保护。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr views Trump-era moves to loosen rules and relax supervision over Wall Street lenders as a mistake, saying that recent capital proposals threaten protections for smaller banks.】

item.title: 沙特政府寻求 100 亿美元的罕见贷款交易
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯正在商谈通过一项罕见的贷款交易筹集多达 100 亿美元的资金，这标志着沙特为王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼的多元化计划筹集资金的努力迈出了最新一步。【原文：Saudi Arabia is in talks to raise as much as $10 billion in a rare loan deal, marking the latest step in the kingdom’s efforts to line up financing for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s diversification plan.】

item.title: 波兰因通胀前景疲软意外降息
item.description: 波兰中央银行出人意料地在今年第四次降低利率，这是一个信号，表明尽管该国采取了宽松的预算政策，但决策者预计价格压力仍将受到遏制。【原文：Poland’s central bank unexpectedly reduced interest rates for a fourth time this year in a signal that policymakers expect price pressure to remain contained despite the country’s accommodative budget policy.】
